goals.question: What is the correlation between GDP per capita and life expectancy?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of GDP per capita vs. life expectancy
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a positive correlation between GDP per capita and life expectancy. If there is a positive correlation, it means that countries with higher GDP per capita tend to have higher life expectancy.

goals.question: What is the distribution of population across different regions?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of population by region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the population distribution across different regions. It will help us identify which regions have the highest and lowest population and how they compare to each other.

goals.question: What is the distribution of CO2 emissions across different regions?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of CO2 emissions by region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the CO2 emissions distribution across different regions. It will help us identify which regions have the highest and lowest CO2 emissions and how they compare to each other.

goals.question: What is the trend of population growth over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of population over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the trend of population growth over time. It will help us identify if the population is increasing or decreasing and at what rate.

goals.question: What is the relationship between child mortality and fertility rate?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of child mortality vs. fertility rate
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a negative correlation between child mortality and fertility rate. If there is a negative correlation, it means that countries with higher fertility rates tend to have lower child mortality rates.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    chart = sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='GDP per capita', y='life expectancy')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        chart.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the correlation between GDP per capita and life expectancy?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.barplot(x='region', y='population', data=data)
    ax.set_xticklabels(ax.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, ha='right')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of population across different regions?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.barplot(x='region', y='CO2_emissions', data=data)
    ax.set_xticklabels(ax.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, ha='right')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of CO2 emissions across different regions?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='population', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the trend of population growth over time?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    if 'date' in data.columns:
        data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    
    max_population = data['population'].max()
    max_date = data.loc[data['population'] == max_population, 'date'].iloc[0]
    plt.axvline(max_date, color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Max Population: {max_population:.2f}')
    plt.legend()
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='child_mortality', y='fertility_rate')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between child mortality and fertility rate?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
